The Curious Case of Nia Long and NCIS: Los Angeles: A Farewell That Wasn't Quite Farewell

Ah, NCIS: Los Angeles. The land of sunglasses, shipyards, and overlooking-explosions-in-slow-motion. It was also, for a time, the stomping ground of the lovely Nia Long. But for how long, exactly? Buckle up, conspiracy theorists, because we're diving into the heart of this mystery.

Enter Shay Mosley: A Brief But Dramatic Spark

Nia Long sashayed onto the scene as Executive Assistant Director Shay Mosley in season nine, bringing a whole new level of boss energy to the NCIS team. She was like a breath of fresh air, but with a side of "don't mess with me or I will take you down."

Did She Leave, or Was She Taken? The Mosley Saga Unfolds

Now, here's where things get interesting. Shay's time on NCIS: Los Angeles wasn't exactly a walk on the beach. Her character arc involved a kidnapped son, a rogue mission to Mexico, and some serious blowback from higher-ups. Let's just say things got messy.

So, How Long Did Nia Long Last?

Nia Long graced us with her presence for a total of 25 episodes, which translates to roughly 137 weeks of catching criminals and looking fabulous while doing it. That's like, two whole years (give or take a leap year) of chasing bad guys in the California sun.

But Wait, There's More!

Here's the real kicker: Shay Mosley's exit wasn't exactly crystal clear. The door was left open for a possible return. So, could Nia Long return to NCIS: Los Angeles someday? Only time will tell, folks. Only time will tell.

In Conclusion: A Farewell (for Now?)

Nia Long's stint on NCIS: Los Angeles might have been brief, but it was undeniably memorable. She brought a new dynamic to the show and left us wanting more. So, here's to the possibility of a future return and, until then, happy re-watching those classic Shay Mosley episodes!
